I Had A Worm Cocoon Into A Naga!
Monster Rancher Metropolis: Monster Rancher 2 Archive (PSOne): Monster Types: Beaclon/Worm: I Had A Worm Cocoon Into A Naga!
By Lisa Shock on Saturday, August 19, 2000 - 12:13 pm:

I was raising a Worm/Monol (-as part of another project which I'll be posting details of later!) and it cocooned into a Naga/Worm on the 4th week of June! I wasn't even thinking about it and it just happened. Here are the details:
Born week 1 March
Frozen a lot
Never stressed (As part of the 'real' experiment, I'm feeding mint and nuts oil almost every week, using the occasional smoked snake and candy.)
I rested it (luckily) on week 3 of June so it was Very Well on week 4.
The worm was NEVER fed cup jelly, it was its 'Dislike'.

My suspicion is that freezing was inconsequential, but that lack of stress may be a factor. It did have a loyalty of 89 at the time.

Anyway, just thought you'd like to know that this is possible in MR2.

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, August 19, 2000 - 11:00 pm:

I suspect that the resulting moster is random, with a worm sub-type. Make sure to save right before-hand so you can reset if you don't like what you get! Since it's going to have a worm sub, there are, of course, monsters it will never produce like Undine, Zilla, Gaboo, etc.

Also, while the appearance will change, and the techs will convert themselves to the equivalent for that monster type, you don't really have a new monster type, at least to the game's internal settings. The preferences, lifespan, etc are all still worm. You can use this monster at the lab to combine and get a real monster of this type, and if you're heart is set on really raising a Naga, this is what you'll have to do!

Here is a list of breeds I got through resetting:
Monol/Worm
Naga/Worm
Jell/Worm
Hare/Worm
Suezo/Worm
Gali/Worm
Pixie/Worm

This list is very similar to the 7 breeds you can get through hatching in MR1, except for one breed. MR1 had Golem and no Suezo.

By Slim_shady_2001 on Wednesday, August 23, 2000 - 05:28 pm:

lisa suggested this experiment and after I got bored today I decided to do it and boy have I got results!

Worm Hatching


Raise A worm ( birthdate doesn’t matter ) Until it’s 4 years old and starting June 1St Rest it until June 4th so it has NO stress or fatigue and on the 4th of June it should Coccoon into a random monster with a Worm sub-type. ( To get the kind of monster you want save on the 3rd of June and rest and reset it until you get the monster you want. )

Theses were my results.

1St try: Naga/Worm
2nd try: Gali/Worm
3rd try: Pixie/Worm
4th try:Suezo/Worm
5th try:Gali/Worm

By Slim_shady_2001 on Wednesday, August 23, 2000 - 05:31 pm:

oh and don't feed it cupjellies

By Lisa Shock on Wednesday, August 23, 2000 - 06:36 pm:

Great job! Lots of people don't know you can do this in MR2, it's fun - and a good way to get more monsters! Just remember that the transformed monster (just like your first Beaclon) is basicly still a worm. The appearance and techs have changed, but all the other game settings are still in 'worm mode'. But, if you want the experience of raising that monster type for real, just use it in combining.

By Nobody on Saturday, August 26, 2000 - 12:18 am:

By Lisa Shock on Saturday, August 26, 2000 - 12:19 pm:

Nope! I was doing a crazy experiment where I wasn't battling my monster had never fought a single battle!
